title: [BEAM-3306] Hash keys when lifting
body:
Hash key values when combiner lifting using the registered coder for the type. Specialized for numeric primitive types to avoid unnecessary work. This turns out to be faster than the general "interface{}" hashing we had previously for numeric type, and is comparable, but marginally slower than native maps with the primitive numeric type as keys. Strings are currently much slower as keys than the native go runtime approach for interfaces{}, as the runtime uses a better hash function. General struct performance (for values Go supported as keys) will be much slower than the go runtime. Pointer elements (with coders) used as keys will be slower, but they'll also be correct, which wasn't the case previously. Care needs to be taken using Maps in Key values, as the Go SDK does not presently sort maps in any fashion prior to encoding. Combined with go map's random iteration order, means combines with such keys will not be valid. A separate in PR will add vetting for this case, to discourage the use of map fields in key types. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-6650] Add bundle test with checkpointing for keyed processing
body:
The checkpointing does not work correctly when FlinkKeyGroupStateInternals are used, i.e. when the DoFn uses keyed KV input. Any elements emitted during finalizeBundle() will not be checkpointed. The test demonstrates the desired behavior. Trying to fix this across Flink 1.5 - 1.7 is a bit tricky due to the different way the timer state is treated. The fix in `DoFnOperator` only works for 1.5. @aljoscha Perhaps you can give some input on this? Couldn't we use Flink's keyed operator state for the buffer output? title: [BEAM-3061] Done notifications for BigtableIO.Write
body:
This adds support for "done" notification in `BigtableIO.write()`. For each bundle+window that is written, a single "Void" is output by the PTransform. Doing so allows flows to effectively wait for all writes to finish. Note that windowing is preserved, and pipeline writers can choose to deal with early firings, etc as they desire. A common use-case of this is to wait for all writes to finish, and then do something else, this can be accomplished using the built-in `Wait.on` transform with the output of the write, like so: ``` val writeResults = mutations.apply( "WriteToBigtable", BigtableIO.write()... ) val collectionToProcessAfterWrites = Create.of("derp") collectionToProcessAfterWrites .apply(Wait.on(writeResults)) .apply(ParDo.of(someFn)) ``` An important point to note here is this only ensures writes have been applied **to a single cluster**, it does not ensure that all writes **have replicated to all clusters**. I had also made a previous PR a few months ago (https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/3997), this is an enhancement of that. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-5449] Add a PostCommit for Reference Runner Python VR tests.
body:
Now that I have Python VR tests for the reference runner, I can make a PostCommit from it. I was tempted to have it be a PreCommit like the Flink version, but decided it wasn't necessary since the reference runner sees much less usage than the Flink runner does. ------------------------ Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-6512] Run GrpcDataServiceTest clients on the main thread
body:
Run gRPC clients on the main thread in GrpcDataServiceTest. Prevents a possible race condition where clients did not add data to `clientInboundElements` until _after_ the assertion was already called. Otherwise `:beam-sdks-python-precommit-dataflow-py3:precommitIT` will use default distribution file that's generated by Python 2 tests in same Jenkins build. title: [BEAM-6607] Fix bug where RowCoder fails if array/map has null values
body:
This wraps inner coders in a NullableCoder if the inner type of an array or value type of a map is nullable. I fixed this slightly differently than was suggested in the JIRA issue. Instead of adding it for both `mapCoder` and `listCoder`, I wrap the coder in `getCoder`. This makes more sense to me as nullability is (as of recently) a property of the FieldType itself. I also deprecated the nullable array and map methods that @kennknowles considered a usability bug. I also moved the RowCoder tests. They were in a weird location that did not seem like it was on purpose. title: add plugin to check if build runs on jenkins
body:
With this PR we reenable findBugs html report on developer machine. As findBugs support only one output format, reporting on Jenkins requires xml format, we need xml reports on ci server, but of course would like to enable the developer to use human friendlier html format. Therefore report format is now set depending on the environment. ------------------------ Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-6619] Add PostCommit sutie for Py3 ITs on DataflowRunner
body:
- Centralize python gradle tests. Keep all precommit in `beam-sdks-python:preCommit` and keep all postcommit in `beam-sdks-python:postCommit` to make `:pythonPreCommit` and `:pythonPostCommit` clear and simple. - Add `beam-sdks-python-precommit-dataflow-py3` for ITs that run on DataflowRunner in Python 3. Use `Py3IT` as Py3 IT tests tag. Two tests are added to this suite in this change: wordcount batch and wordcount batch on FnAPI. - Rename task `precommitIT` to `preCommitIT` for consistency. ------------------------ Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-4164] [BEAM-6591] Refactor, improve and fix CassandraIO
body:
This PR does the following: - replaces the mock by an embedded cassandra instance in UTests - refactors CassandraIO: remove CassandraService (which main justification was for injecting the mock), various code simplifications - add new tests: testSplit - fixes a bug in split in the production code (https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-6591) discovered with the addition of the missing testSplit. - Fixes all the tests. I have already squashed history to isolable commits for both ease the review of the refactoring and allow an easy rollback of the refactoring if need. I think the history should not be squashed more. title: [BEAM-6608] Prepare to-be-staged files early enough in Flink Runner
body:
#### [BEAM-6608] Prepare to-be-staged files early enough in Flink Runner Before execution, the Flink Runner prepares all necessary files, in order for them to be shipped to the remote cluster. Due to a recent regression via BEAM-2873, the preparation is performed after the execution environment has been initialized. This skips the preparation phase and results in invalid files being shipped. #### [BEAM-6609] Default tempLocation in FlinkPipelineOptions to default tmp directory Includes this second commit because it is an easy fix and works on the same files. There should be a sensible default, so users don't have to configure the temp path by default. title: [BEAM-6602] Preparatory PR for integrating schemas into BigQuery: Push TableRow conversion to end of pipeline
body: This sets the stage for using schemas in BigQueryIO. This also has the advantage of being more efficient in the scenario where the user provides a PCollection<T> and a format function T -> TableRow. TableRow is encoded as JSON, so shuffling these objects is expensive. The user's T is often a more efficient object, so shuffling those objects is preferable.

title: Update starcgen for new types
body:
Updates the starcgen code generator to better handle Pointer, Map, and Array types. * Slice suffix for function names is now a prefix to avoid collisions in ordering with Maps of Slice of Arrays or similar * Filter out "universal" named types such as error. * Filter out Beam internal types (beam.X/typex.X and similar) * Improve test coverage for both the templates and the analyzer. * Regenerate the beam shims with `go generate ./...` ------------------------ Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-5638] Exception handling for Java MapElements and FlatMapElements
body:
Previously attempted in #6586, this new PR incorporates feedback from the previous review and provides some additional convenience. The most important change is that the interface now expects users to provide an exception handler function that outputs elements that are efficiently codable as originally suggested by @tims. Common features have been implemented in a new `WithExceptions` class, and the top-level documentation there is the best place to look for an overview of the approach here. This PR does not address Filter, AsJsons, and ParseJsons. Those could be added in a future PR. ------------------------ Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-3306] Add first pass coder registry for Go
body:
This PR does several interlocking things: * Expands FullType to accept maps, points & arrays as user types. * Also adds interface types, but they will fail at construction time if the interface isn't registered. * Adds tests for new permitted types, and recursive structs that they allow. * Increases the internal coder package test coverage. * BREAKING: No longer exporting beam.ProtoEnc, beam.ProtoDec, beam.JSONEnc, and beam.JSONDec. They shouldn't have been exported in the first place. * Adds basic coder registry support. * Interface is subject to change. It might be worthwhile to add a "name" to various custom coders to permit them to be enabled/disabled at will. This would require other surface changes. A work around would be to define a new type `type newType oldType` if differential behavior is desired, and casting between the two as necessary. IMPORTANT: This doesn't yet permit using pointer, slice, map, or interface types as Key types. The Combiner code needs to be updated to encode key values before pre-combining. ------------------------ Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-5816] Finish Flink bundles exactly once
body:
When an error an occurred in an operator chain, `dipose()` could be called multiple times leading to duplicate calls to `invokeFinishBundle()`, some of which actions expect to release resources only once. Also, the bundle expiration timer could call finish bundle simultaneously with `dipose()`. This makes the finish bundle logic execute exactly once by making it atomic. Note: This did not affect correctness of results but the change ensures there are no duplicate cleanup calls. title: [BEAM-6569] Re-add gcsio_test to py3-gcp test suite
body:
This PR re-adds the gcio_test to the py3-gcp tox suite. This test was removed in #7691 due to being flaky. However, the problem here was not a flaky test, but that the test was included twice in the test suite (see [this comment](https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/7691#issuecomment-459431122)). The same mocked object is used twice, which resulted in the iterator being exhausted during the second test. In [the logs](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PreCommit_Python_Commit/4034/console) of one of the runs that flagged this test as flaky, we can see that the test passed the first time, and failed the second time. > 12:54:06 test_rename (apache_beam.io.gcp.gcsio_test.TestGCSIO) ... ok > ... > 12:54:06 test_rename (apache_beam.io.gcp.gcsio_test.TestGCSIO) ... title: [BEAM-6019] Report root cause of failure in Flink portable pipelines
body:
The `JobInvocation` only reported the top-most message in the stack trace. This changes the reporting to pass on the root cause instead. Unblocks several Python PVR tests which rely on exception reporting.
